sentence.Network_en: The teacher checked the roster to see whom he would teach this year.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (originally denoting a list of duties and leave for military personnel): from Dutch rooster 'list', earlier 'gridiron', from roosten 'to roast', with reference to its parallel lines

entry.def: A roster is a list which gives details of the order in which different people have to do a particular job.

example.ex: The next day he put himself first on the new roster for domestic chores...
example.tran: 第二天，他把自己排在了新的家务值日表的第一位。

example.ex: He was in his office, preparing his duty roster for the coming month.
example.tran: 他正在自己的办公室里制定下一个月的执勤表。

entry.tran: 名单;花名册;登记表;运动员名册（尤用于美国英语中）
entry.def: A roster is a list, especially of the people who work for a particular organization or are available to do a particular job. It can also be a list of the sports players who are available for a particular team, especially in American English.

example.ex: The Amateur Softball Association's roster of umpires has declined to 57,000...
example.tran: 业余垒球协会的裁判员名单上的人数已经减少到了57,000名。

example.ex: From the studio's roster of leading men, Robert Walker was an obvious choice to play the part.
example.tran: 从该电影公司的男主角名单来看，罗伯特·沃克显然是出演这一角色的不二人选。

sentences.sentence: "his name was struck off the rolls"
